question: A device driver can be thought of like a translator
options: ['a) high level, low level', 'b) low level, high level', 'c) complex, simple', 'd) low level, complex']

question: The file organization module knows about _____________
options: ['a) files', 'b) logical blocks of files', 'c) physical blocks of files', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: Metadata includes _____________
options: ['a) all of the file system structure', 'b) contents of files', 'c) both file system structure and contents of files', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) all of the file system structure
option3: c) both file system structure and contents of files

question: For each file there exists a ___________ that contains information about the file, including ownership, permissions and location of the file contents
options: ['a) metadata', 'b) file control block', 'c) process control block', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: For processes to request access to file contents, they need _____________
options: ['a) to run a seperate program', 'b) special interrupts', 'c) to implement the open and close system calls', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) to run a seperate program
option3: c) to implement the open and close system calls

question: During compaction time, other normal system operations _______ be permitted
options: ['a) can', 'b) cannot', 'c) is', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: When in contiguous allocation the space cannot be extended easily?
options: ['a) the contents of the file have to be copied to a new space, a larger hole', 'b) the file gets destroyed', 'c) the file will get formatted and lost all its data', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) the contents of the file have to be copied to a new space, a larger hole
option3: c) the file will get formatted and lost all its data

question: In the linked allocation, the directory contains a pointer to which block?
options: ['I. first block', 'II. last block', 'a) I only', 'b) II only']

question: There is no __________ with linked allocation
options: ['a) internal fragmentation', 'b) external fragmentation', 'c) starvation', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: What is the major disadvantage with a linked allocation?
options: ['a) internal fragmentation', 'b) external fragmentation', 'c) there is no sequential access', 'd) there is only sequential access']
option3: c) there is no sequential access
option4: d) there is only sequential access

question: What if a pointer is lost or damaged in a linked allocation?
options: ['a) the entire file could get damaged', 'b) only a part of the file would be affected', 'c) there would not be any problems', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) the entire file could get damaged
option2: b) only a part of the file would be affected
option3: c) there would not be any problems

question: FAT stands for _____________
options: ['a) File Attribute Transport', 'b) File Allocation Table', 'c) Fork At Time', 'd) None of the mentioned']

question: By using FAT, random access time is __________
options: ['a) the same', 'b) increased', 'c) decreased', 'd) not affected']
